intro: Mitrasacme crystallina, commonly known as the crystalline mitrasacme, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, translucent, waxy leaves that reflect light, giving it a shimmering appearance. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
